citation.article-title: Flavobacterium chungbukense sp. nov., isolated from soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Flavobacterium chungbukense sp. nov.
Flavobacterium chungbukense (chung.bu.ken′se. N.L. neut. adj. chungbukense of or belonging to Chungbuk, a province in Korea, from where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-staining-negative, strictly aerobic, non-motile, rod-shaped, approximately 0.4–0.6 µm in diameter and 8.0–15.0 µm in length.
Gliding motility is absent.
Colonies are yellow, circular, smooth and convex with entire margins after 3 days of incubation at 25 °C on TSA.
Growth occurs on TSA, R2A and NA, but not on MA or MacConkey agar.
Grows at 4–30 °C (optimum, 25 °C), at pH 5.0–9.0 (optimum, pH 7.0) and in the presence of 0–2 % (w/v) NaCl (optimum 0–1 %).
Oxidase and catalase activities are present.
Flexirubin-type pigments are produced.
Congo red is not adsorbed by colonies.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrogen.
Indole production, glucose fermentation and arginine dihydrolase activity are absent (API 20NE).
Starch, skimmed milk, gelatin, aesculin and DNA are hydrolysed.
Chitin, pectin, urea, CMC and agar are not hydrolysed.

Acid is produced from d-arabinose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-lactose, d-mannose, d-xylose, l-rhamnose, cellobiose, maltose, melezitose, melibiose and sucrose, but not from d-mannitol, d-sorbitol or inositol.

Utilizes d-glucose, d-mannose, d-maltose, d-melibiose, d-sucrose, l-arabinose, l-proline, N-acetylglucosamine, glycogen, maltose, rhamnose and salicin, but does not utilize d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, d-ribose, dl-lactate, l-alanine, l-serine, l-histidine, l-fucose, 2-ketogluconate, 3-hydroxybutyrate, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, 5-ketogluconate, adipate, caprate, malic acid, phenylacetic acid, citrate, potassium gluconate, propionate, valerate, inositol, itaconate, suberate, malonate or acetate (API 20NE and API ID32 GN).

Alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase activities are present, but lipase (C14), trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, α-mannosidase, α-fucosidase, β-galactosidase and β-glucuronidase activities are absent (API ZYM).
Antagonistic to L. monocytogenes and S. aureus.
Resistant to gentamicin, kanamycin, spectinomycin and streptomycin, but sensitive to ampicillin, chloramphenicol, penicillin G and tetracycline.
Menaquinone-6 (MK-6) is the major isoprenoid quinone.
The major cellular fatty acids (>11 %) are iso-C15 : 0, summed feature 3 (comprising iso-C15 : 0 2-OH and/or C16 : 1ω7c) and C16 : 0.
The type strain, CS100T ( = KACC 15048T = JCM 17386T), was isolated from soil in Cheongju, Chungbuk, Republic of Korea.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 36.4 mol%.
